籤詩版本二:
Going in and out of the camp to seek great prosperity
Like jade, flawless hidden in stone
If someone can guide me,
At this time, the treasures are happy and the scenery is beautiful
詩意: This hexagram stone represents the treasure hidden in it. Everything goes well.
解曰: Like stone hiding jade. The noble man's instructions are only satisfactory. Happy and proud.
籤詩故事一:
◇ Emperor Yang looked at Qionghua
The viburnum blooms once a year, and in the evening. Emperor Yang of the Sui Dynasty heard someone say that the Qionghua flower in Yangzhou was unparalleled in the world, as white as jade, graceful, delicate and elegant. Taking the imperial concubine on a dragon boat, they went to Yangzhou to enjoy the flowers, which was full of pomp and pageantry, with flags flying.
(The metaphor of this story is that things are as precious as this "Qionghua". If it doesn't appear, it will be nothing. If it does, it will surprise you.)
聖意:
The home is auspicious.
Self: Kangtai.
Asking for wealth, then.
Transaction completed.
Marriage achievement.
Liujia: Give birth to a boy.
Pedestrians move.
Tian Can: Work hard.


Six animals: diligent and rational.
Looking for someone to meet.
The lawsuit was won.
Migration is lucky.
The lost thing is there.
Disease: An.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
